summary: Kyiv, also known as Kiev, is Ukraine's capital and largest city, located along the Dnieper River. With a population of over 2.9 million (as of 2022), it is one of Europe's most populous cities. Kyiv is a significant cultural, educational, and industrial hub. Its history dates back to the 5th century, with legendary founders and various rulers, including Vikings and the Khazars. The city was once the capital of Kievan Rus' and experienced ups and downs, including destruction by the Mongols. Today, Kyiv supports Ukraine's economy and is pro-Western in its political leanings.
title: Kyiv
